page.title: 05Kimbolton School (Present)
page.content: In 1950 the School acquired {Kimbolton Castle}and its surrounding grounds. In 1975 it became an independent school on the government's abolition of{Direct Grant status.}In 1976 it became a co-educational school. The castle influences the school's character, and vice-versa.The original medieval hall is now a library; the family chapel is crammed for school worship; the apartment once used by{Catherine of Aragon}is the Headmaster's study. Vanbrugh's south facade provides a unique setting for cricket, and the C17 courtyard for drama. Numerous new buildings have been erected in the grounds and the school roll has grown to 150 (8-11) and 500 (11-18).The proportion of boarders has declined but population growth in the area has ensured ample day applicants.
